Welcome to A Java Tutor!!

Java Install:

Some PCs might have Java already installed. To check whether you have Java installed or not, Put the bellowed command code into a terminal: (powershell,command Prompt)

C:\Users\Your Name>java -version

Next Step:

{/*

{'aaaaaaa%3A b \n bbbb%22 bbbb%22 bbbbbbbbbb'}

*/}

If Java is installed, you will see something like this (depending on version):

java version "18" 2022-03-22
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 18+36-2087)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 18+36-2087, mixed mode, sharing)

If not, you can download Java for free at the official website oracle.com.

A Simple Quickstart

In Java,

  1. every application begins with a class name, and that class must match the filename.
  2. Code runs in Java must be inside a class
  3. A class name should always start with an Uppercase first letter
  4. Java is case-sensitive: ‘Mytutor’ is totally different from ‘mytutor’
  5. Every Java program require a main () method:
    public static void main(String[] args)
  6. Code inside the main () method will be executed

How To run A Java Code

Follow these four basic steps:

  1. We should save our code
  2. Go to a terminal and navigate to the directory where our code is
  3. Type in “javac Main.java”. (this would compile the java code, if there are no errors, the terminal will take you to the next line)
  4. Type in “java Main” (to finally run the code)

) } export default Home
